intro: Agapetes meliphagidum, commonly known as the honeybee plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Agapetes meliphagidum is notable for its role in pollination, as its flowers are specifically adapted to attract bees and other pollinators.
